meanings.sent1: The untalented singer struggled to hit the right notes.
meanings.sent2: She felt untalented compared to her artistic friends.
meanings.sent3: The untalented chef burned water while trying to boil it.
meanings.sent4: His untalented attempts at painting resembled a child's finger painting.
meanings.sent5: The untalented dancer tripped over their own feet during the performance.

meanings.definition: Not possessing natural ability or aptitude
meanings.sent1: The untalented student found math to be a challenging subject.
meanings.sent2: He was untalented in sports but excelled in academics.
meanings.sent3: The untalented comedian's jokes fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her untalented gardening skills turned the backyard into a jungle.
meanings.sent5: The untalented actor struggled to remember their lines on stage.
